intro: Hoffmannia cryptoneura, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hoffmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories, where it thrives in humid conditions. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hoffmannia cryptoneura is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
